South Tees NHS has done a good job of maintaining normal surgery.  I am always happy to raise your mum’s appointments.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Deeply, deeply cynical from the SNP.  Attempting to confect a row over NHS pay *when they have the requisite powers and funding to meet their own commitment*.  Such tawdry politics.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @jimbobalula1 My focus is entirely on ensuring our area moves from Tier 3 to Tier 2 at the earliest opportunity, and the data is shaping up well ahead of the 16 December review point on all the key metrics.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @jimbobalula1 Hi - I will have to take that on the chin, because I will vote with the Government tonight.  We have to bridge the period between now and vaccine rollout being substantially underway/complete, and nobody has told me how we can proceed otherwise without many thousands more deaths.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: So weak from Labour. To not take a position on an issue of this magnitude just about sums up where they stand under Sir Kier Starmer - everywhere and nowhere, seeking to please everyone.

tweet: Our new agriculture policy demonstrates perfectly why we left the EU: more rational, more environmentally friendly, utterly impossible to deliver within the superstate.

name: Simon Clarke MP

And admitting to “banging house parties” for 10 is a clear breach of the law, which isn’t big or clever.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @Calum92Stevens 357m doses for double vaccination of up to 67m people, Calum. And given how loudly you complain about the choices being made to try to save thousands of lives, please don’t turn around and be another person saying “you couldn’t pay me to take this”...

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Brilliant work from my neighbour and friend @Matt_VickersMP ⬇️

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Hugely welcome news from @pritipatel tonight. The scandal of illegal cross-Channel migration is the single issue that most frustrates my constituents, and this is a major step towards tackling it. Legislation for a new asylum framework that is firm and fair will be very welcome.  https://t.co/F05fF6o06a

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @mrmerv31 The levels of scrutiny and testing being applied are very rigorous.   I recognise the very problematic legacy of some Gulf War medicines, but this really is being held to a different standard and has the full weight of public and private sector behind it. I’ll have it for sure.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @mrmerv31 There is no way this disruption ends unless the great majority of the population have a vaccine.  I don’t see how it is tenable to simultaneously say “this situation is dreadful, end it” and then refuse the cure.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @mrmerv31 I am very happy to look at whatever support I can re your grant application - just email me if at all helpful.  I can assure you the government is balancing the advice it receives, and consistently looking to protect lives and livelihoods.  It’s really tough, but it is ending.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @mrmerv31 I don’t dispute this is terrible for many businesses - hence the grant system in place for those forced to close/operating at reduced capacity, as well as the extension of furlough.  We all want it to end and it will over the first quarter of 2021.  Darkest hour time.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @mrmerv31 It doesn’t work like that, sadly - the idea you can isolate 10/15m effectively from the wider population is just not viable, added to which you would then see a much higher infection rate among the under 60s which would still put untenable pressure on the health service.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @mrmerv31 The difference compared to the situation this summer is that there is now an end in sight - mass testing and a range of effective vaccines means we know this situation will have very substantially resolved itself by Easter.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @mrmerv31 Hi Gaz - what precisely do you want us to do? We have seen this autumn what happens when the virus accelerates, and the death toll *even with restrictions* is high. I certainly want Tees Valley in Tier 2 if current progress is maintained, but can’t see how you can safely do more.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: There has been a really significant fall in Coronavirus rates in #Middlesbrough over the last week.  It’s far from time to relax, but a 40%+ reduction over the last 7 days is great.  Let’s keep it going.  Tier 2 then comes into view.   https://t.co/t8jaz2zKgS

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @SuellaBraverman Lovely news, Suella!

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: David Frost is, as always, superb. Sovereignty goes to the heart of our exit from the EU.  This was never a cosmetic exercise.  It was a fundamental reassertion of our right to self-government.

tweet: We await word on which tier the Tees Valley will be placed in - but with mass testing underway and several effective vaccines imminent, there is now a clear strategy for a return to normality in the early months of the New Year.  Tier allocations will be reviewed every two weeks.

tweet: @ollie299792458 @MattHancock I’m afraid you are fundamentally wrong in that assessment Oliver. The NHS budget is at a record high and this was never about money anyway. name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Definitely my key issue this week. Working with Middlesbrough surgeon Joel Dunning, I am trying to secure NHS surgery for my constituent “Katie”, who suffers from the rare condition pectus excavatum. Big thanks to @MattHancock for his time and attention.   https://t.co/PD9tdZ1cn1

tweet: This is exactly right from @tomriordan - and is a point I raised in the Commons yesterday.  Explain the benefits of vaccination, why it is safe and important, and take on the *nonsense* that is running around on too much of our social media about it.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Good to speak in today’s debate on the impact of Covid-19 on people living with Alzheimer’s and dementia.  It’s vital we prioritise lateral flow tests to ensure those living in care homes can receive family visits again ASAP.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: A very well deserved accolade for @SharonLaneTEES - a brilliant female engineering entrepreneur and a star figure in the Tees Valley business community.  She will make a huge contribution 👇    https://t.co/lzhweOaYb9

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: My constituent @AllyP1967 does incredible work supporting literacy across #Middlesbrough.  Invariably positive and focused on children in a town where levelling up life chances will require the very best of the public, private and charitable sectors working in tandem.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @mattlodder It’s the relentless drive by some to turn history into a matter of 21st century centre-left sensibilities and morality that is unhelpful and often ahistorical.  But I’ll leave you to get on with writing about tattoos.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Repeating after Keir Starmer’s attack at PMQs.  Labour refusing to understand / seeking to misrepresent the truth that the money they claim is for PR is in fact for educating the public about vaccines (and combating the public health menace of anti-vax propaganda).

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: This is a very important and sensible point by @JacobYoungMP.  Care home residents and their close families must be a logical and compassionate priority.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: This.  The U.K. has made vital decisions in terms of how and where to invest in vaccine development, and the benefits in terms of lives and livelihoods flowing from apparently good choices could, should, be enormous.  Kate Bingham deserves our sincere thanks for leading this.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @Dara_Sanwal And therein lies the point - a range of views.  This lockdown will, sadly, do great harm and cost lives and jobs in its own right.  There can be no apology for trying to avoid it.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @Dara_Sanwal  https://t.co/qNt2fvHNRz

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @Dara_Sanwal Dara, you need to ask yourself - why would you inflict the undoubted huge economic, social and medical damage of lockdown when your medical experts continue to advise a regional approach was viable?

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @RossHamMil Yes.  When the Deputy CMO was advising that a national circuit breaker wasn’t sensible.  Why on earth should we apologise for trying to avoid the huge harm lockdown brings with it?

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Entirely fair from Michael Gove.  These are very difficult times, but I can’t see how Government can apologise for (1) doing all in its power to keep our economy and society open when that was deemed viable and (2) responding to new data when it is presented with it.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Appropriate in more ways than one this weekend.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: This is the big story of our century.  We all know the West is not perfect, but we must never lose confidence in our fundamental values.  Free markets, equality before the law, freedom of expression, conscience and association.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Rosedene are incredibly deserving of their nominations for the @NMTmagazine awards.  I couldn’t have been more impressed by my visit to their #Guisborough nursery this summer.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Humane, sensible and dignified, with appropriate safeguards in place.  Such a change in the law is overdue in the U.K.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Well said @sajidjavid.  This almost defies belief.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: What @michaelgove says to @Keir_Starmer is spot on:  “Fundamentally, this is a question of leadership. It is easy to take a position on antisemitism in hindsight, but you seemingly found it much harder to find the moral character and backbone to do what was right at the time.”

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @SuzieCooch Teesside. You may realise, dimly, that it’s not really a time for normal visits, hence file photos

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Very sobering news.  All good wishes to the lovely @juliedonaldson, whose radio show brightens so many lives.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @SuzieCooch @ClevelandPolice @BorisJohnson @pritipatel The photo is from February

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @peoplemattershr Sheila, public spending fell because the country went bust (meanwhile our Force was being run into the ground by its hapless PCC).  The photo predates lockdown.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Great news today that @ClevelandPolice have been strengthened by 146 more officers over the course of the last year - well done @BorisJohnson and @pritipatel for listening to the people’s priorities.      https://t.co/thTBCKE9Sz

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Once again, all right thinking people will stand by France in the face of this savagery.  Those world leaders who have been whipping up hate against the Republic have much to answer for.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @LecturerMark You are part of the problem, Mark

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: We knew when campaigning to stop Jeremy Corbyn from becoming PM in 2017 and 2019 that we were doing the right thing. Today’s #EHRC report establishes beyond doubt that the Labour Party he created in his image, which Keir Starmer campaigned to put in office, was toxic.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: This is the right approach by the Government.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Great to see new businesses opening, even in such challenging situations.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Great to see ministerial support for this exciting new venture 🏗 🌍

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Levelling up matters enormously.  Great to see @RobertJenrick announce the first set of Town Deals - including for #Darlington!

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: This is a really exciting announcement - getting CCUS established off the Tees and Humber estuaries should be a major national priority, and it’s great the Government has committed to this technology.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @sarahphillipson @MbroCouncil @RedcarCleveland Perhaps some of the £7.29m the Govt gave our two local councils this month  https://t.co/xkkzPplcQl

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @Carl_Quartz @middlesbrough @RedcarCleveland @JacobYoungMP Carl, you do realise that our councils are receiving central government money to assist with all this, don’t you?  https://t.co/hZwZNZLufG

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: A reminder of the very substantial sums of money pledged to both @MbroCouncil and @RedcarCleveland as part of the Government’s £63m fund to help struggling families (part of the wider £9bn increase in welfare support delivered since Covid began).  https://t.co/ciknWAcPUN

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @DeniseNesbitt @nigel_guisboro With great respect, Denise, that is absolutely none of your business.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Politics can and should be robust.  I accept some decisions will inevitably be controversial and I stand by them.  But the sheer vitriol of the last few days has been extraordinary and disgusting.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @MirandaJupp It isn’t

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Ludicrous.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @Rad_AaronR Right 🤨

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @Rad_AaronR I did so by listening to my voters, and by respecting and responding to their views on jobs, welfare reform, the Brexit vote, crime and so on.  Next time a doctor wants to come and lecture me on how to prevent welfare dependency - or stand for election - be my guest.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @Rad_AaronR I have no idea who you are, but feel free to rant into space about the fact I was educated privately.  Not something I have ever made a secret of.  I am middle class and not ashamed of that - and I have worked hard to turn a working class constituency into a Conservative one.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Delighted to see this action by @RishiSunak. Something I warmly support and that will make a big difference for areas like Middlesbrough and Redcar & Cleveland that are currently in Tier 2 measures.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @Craig_Honeyman @Boro Craig, I think you are missing the full facts here.  We have added £9 BILLION to the welfare system since Covid began, increasing Universal Credit by £1,000/year and increasing Local Housing Allowance.  On top of this is £63m for local welfare assistance.  https://t.co/y0CpXgjRSZ

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: Reflecting my experience that my constituents broadly believe the Government is doing its best in the face of unprecedented challenges, and that they don’t like political opportunism on the basis “this is a good crisis for Labour to exploit”.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @AndyMcDonaldMP Andy, you represent a Labour Party hammered on Teesside just months ago. You’re the ones ignoring the DCMO yesterday when he said there is no case for a national lockdown. We have put over £200 billion into Covid support. While some mayors work constructively; others grandstand.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @RMCunliffe Means that a change to FSM in holidays all the time would represent a shift towards eroding parental responsibility and increasing state dependency.  With UC increased by £1000/yr and more generous LHA and billions more for councils, this isn’t what we should be doing.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @RMCunliffe It’s our wider £9bn injection of additional funding into the welfare state that should be focused upon - significantly more than the triple lock we pledged to pensioners.  This, coupled with the fact children are now back in school (1/2)

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: PM totally right that Labour’s position to turn the lights out with a national lockdown would be a disaster for the country.  And let’s face it, it would be *repeated* lockdowns if Starmer has his way.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @RMCunliffe There is a further £63m for hardship available to councils and £16m for food charities.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @RMCunliffe Hi Rachel, we have put an extra £9bn into the welfare system, raising the standard rate of UC by £1000 and increasing local housing allowance.  In the summer, most children hadn’t been in school for months; today, almost all of them are back. Comparing apples and oranges.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @tweeting_keith GM has received £1.1bn in business grants and reliefs, almost £200m in unringfenced funding for councils, £49m for infection control, £22m for test and trace. A further £22m granted and an additional £60m on the table if agreement can be reached - as in Liverpool, Lancs, S Yorks.

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: @brexit_sham Ouch.  Zinger.  https://t.co/1oHyh8nB3z

name: Simon Clarke MP
tweet: This is just naked politics from Labour now. As Dan Jarvis has shown this morning and Steve Rotherham did last week, it is entirely possible to negotiate good deals with the Government for areas moving into Tier 3. The offer of £60m additional support remains for Gtr Manchester.
